items.todoItem: Know that every one of us shall give account of them self to God.
Know that every tongue shall confess to God.
Know that God sees all things and we must each give account for our self.
Accuse not a servant unto his master.
Don’t be an accuser of the brethren.
Expect persecution and false accusation for Jesus’ sake.
Know that the devil accuses the brethren before God day and night.
Know that you are holy and blameless in God’s sight without accusation.
Don’t walk in the counsel of the ungodly.
Hear the advice of your father and mother and don’t ignore or forget it.
Know that God advised Joseph in a dream not to be afraid to take Mary as his wife because that which was conceived in her was of the Holy Spirit.
Know that God does not need or seek advice from anybody.
Know that God guides us with His counsel and afterward will receive us into glory.
Know that God speaks to us to offer us advice and give us revelation.
Know that the Holy Spirit will guide you into all truth.
Let the Lord teach you and guide you.
Seek God’s instruction in everything you do and He will make your paths pleasant and prosperous.
Seek out wise counsellors.
Turn around at wisdom’s reproof and stop ignoring good advice.
Know that God may send angels to speak to people in dreams.
Know that Jesus has a more excellent name than the angels.
Know that the devil was cast out into the Earth and his angels with him.
Be angry without sinning.
Be slow to anger.
Cease from anger and forsake wrath.
Don’t hold on to your anger; be rid of it before the end of the day.
Fathers, do not provoke your children to anger.
Give place to wrath.
Know that a soft answer turns away wrath.
Know that God is slow to anger.
Know that God’s anger will come upon the children of disobedience because of immorality, impurity and greed.
Know that grievous words stir up anger.
Know that the Lord is slow to anger and of great mercy.
Put all anger and resentment away from you.
Turn away wrath.
Know that everyone who denies that Jesus Christ is come in the flesh is not of God.
Know that the spirit of antichrist is already in the world.
Know that those who are not of God speak of the world and the world hears them.
Avoid foolish and ignorant questions knowing that they lead to arguments.
Be a peacemaker.
Cast out the scorner and contention and contempt will cease.
Do not get into heated disputes and shout loud and angry complaints and demands.
Don’t argue with someone for no reason.
Don’t let your lips enter into contention.
Humbly instruct those who oppose you.
Know that God hates those that cause disagreement and contention among brethren.
Know that the servant of the Lord must not argue but be gentle with everyone.
Leave off contention.
Be ready to take the good news of Christ and His peace with you everywhere you go.
Be thankful to God that He provides us with a defence and protection against the devil.
Know that God is a shield to them that put their trust in Him.
Know that without the whole armour of God you will not be able to withstand the daily evil attacks of the enemy.
Make sure you are always properly dressed in the armour of God before you face the evil of the day.
Put on the whole armour of God so that you may be able to stand against the sly trickery and traps of the devil.
Stand wearing truth as a belt, knowing that it is God’s truth that supports and holds everything together in your life.
Take the helmet of salvation and keep receipt of it firmly in your mind.
Take the shield of faith, your most important protection, that will enable you to overcome everything that the enemy throws at you.
Take the sword of the Spirit (the Word of God) as both a weapon and a defence.
Take up and use the whole armour of God so that you may be able to resist and oppose when evil attacks.
Know that Christ was made a curse for us when He hung on the tree.
Know that even though God sees a man as a sinner, He still loves him and desires to redeem him.
Know that God had an eternal purpose for the life and death of Jesus.
Know that in Christ our sins (past, present and future) have been forgiven through the ransom blood of Jesus.
Know that in Christ we have been redeemed through the blood of Jesus.
Know that Jesus is the propitiation for our sins and and also for the sins of the whole world.

Know that the sacrifice of Jesus was so that He might sanctify His church, having cleansed it with the purifying power of God’s Word, so that He might present His church to Himself as a glorious church that is holy and unblemished in His sight.
Know that the Son of God loves you and gave His life for you.
Know that you have a clean conscience through the blood of Christ.
Remember that Jesus gave His life for us as an offering and a sacrifice which was pleasing to God.
Be obedient to the people in authority over you.
Be strong in the Lord and in the power of His might.
Be subject to authority for conscience sake.
Be subject to principalities and powers.
Be subject to the higher powers ordained by God.
Children, obey your parents as the Lord commands, for this is right in His eyes.
Do not resist those placed in authority by God.
Don’t limit your obedience to those in authority over you to only when they are watching you in order to please them.
Give those in authority over you the same respect (with fear and trembling) and whole-hearted loyalty that you would give to Jesus.
Honour those in authority.
Know that authority is placed over you for your good.
Know that God has set Jesus at His own right hand in heaven.
Know that God is sovereign, having supreme power and authority to rule as He chooses.
Know that God the Father has put all things in subjection to Jesus.
Know that God the Father has set Jesus as head over all things to the church.
Know that Jesus has absolute sovereignty and supreme authority over all things.
Know that Jesus is head of the church.
Know that Jesus is set far above every power and name that is named, not only in this world but also in that which is to come.
Know that just as the head commands the body, so Jesus commands the church.
Know that Satan is currently the ruler of this world.
Know that the Father has given Jesus all authority to execute judgement.
Know that the Holy Spirit is the power of God.
Know that the powers that be are ordained by God.
Know that there is no power but of God.
Know that there is only one Lord, the Lord Jesus Christ.
Know that those in authority are the ministers of God.
Know that we are kept by the power of God through faith unto salvation.
Know that whatsoever good thing any man does, the same shall he receive of the Lord, whether he is under authority or not.
Obey them that have rule over you and submit to them.
Obey those in authority over you as a servant of Christ, doing the will of God in sincerity.
Pay taxes to whoever they are due.
Pay your taxes.
Serve those in authority over you willingly, as if to the Lord and not to men.
Submit yourselves to every ordinance of man for the Lord’s sake
When in authority, do not abuse your position to threaten others knowing that you too also have a Master who is in heaven.
When in authority, reward all those who do good work impartially, just as the Lord does.
Whether you are in authority or under authority, seek to serve and please God, not men.
Baptize all nations in the name of the Father, Son and Holy Ghost.
Know that by baptism into Christ you have put on Christ.
Know that there is only one baptism, baptism into Christ.
Know that we were baptised into the death of Jesus Christ.
Know that you are buried with Christ by baptism into death.
Repent and be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ.
Know that Jesus was with God from the beginning.
As a beloved child of God, become totally dependent on God your Father.
As a beloved child of God, seek to become an imitator of God your Father who is kind, compassionate and forgiving.
Be led by the Spirit.
Choose to put off your old sinful nature and behaviours.
Demonstrate mercy and truth in the way that you live.
Demonstrate obedience to sound wisdom and discretion.
Do not become defiled through moral impurity or sinfulness.
Do not become drunk with alcohol which is the type of depraved behaviour exhibited by those who carelessly indulge to riotous excess and who cannot be saved.
Do not become obsessed with the possession of worldly things or the accumulation of wealth.
Do not commit idolatry; the desertion of the worship of the true God for the worship of idols.
Do not commit illicit sexual intercourse such as adultery, fornication, homosexuality, bestiality or incest.
Do not live foolishly.
Do not make the Holy Spirit of God sorrowful by the way that you speak or act.
Do not partake in the ways of the children of disobedience.
Do not participate in works of darkness which are sinful and unprofitable but rather confront those who do and expose their shameful works convicting them of their fault.
Don’t give the devil any room to operate anywhere in your life.
Exercise great patience and restraint with one another in godly love.
Give no one any cause whatsoever to accuse you of sexual immorality, impurity, idolatry or greed.
Know that if you have heard and been taught the truth by Jesus then you can no longer live and behave as you did before according to your old nature.
Know that in the past it was our nature to live just like others who are worthy of the wrath of God.
Know that it is shameful even to talk about the things done by the children of disobedience in secret.
Know that Jesus did not teach you to live like other Gentiles.
Know that neither sexual immorality, impurity, idolatry nor greed is to have any place whatsoever in the body of Christ.
Know that no man ever hated his own flesh but rather nourishes and cherishes it, just as Jesus does the church.
Know that the righteousness of the law is fulfilled by those who walk after the Spirit.
Know that we were raised with Christ from the dead to walk in newness of life.
Know that you no longer walk in the flesh but in the Spirit.
Know that your former life was influenced and guided by the standards of this world.
Know that your old nature was corrupted by selfish and deceitful desires.
Live a life full of love, loving others just as Jesus loved us.
Live in a manner worthy of God’s calling in response to all that God has done for you.
Pray that you may be firmly rooted and grounded in God’s unconditional love.
Remain calm and in submission to the divine will, not easily provoked and without murmuring at injury or provocation.
Remember that in the past we were Gentiles and lived according to the lusts of the flesh.
Remember that you once walked in darkness without understanding but now, in Christ, you have the light of life.
Stop behaving like other Gentiles who live only for their own futile pursuits and vain thoughts.
Walk as a child of God in the light of the knowledge of God.
Walk by faith, not by sight.
Walk carefully and use your time wisely to do good because the days in which we live are evil.
Walk free from pride in all humbleness of mind.
Walk in newness of life.
Walk in the light of God’s truth discerning what is well pleasing to God.
Walk in the Spirit and you will escape from sinful desires.
Walk in the way of good men.
Walk with all lowliness and meekness just as Jesus did.
Walk with wise men and you will become wise.
Walk worthy of God, who has called you to His kingdom and glory.
Know that a star appeared and stood over where Jesus was born.
Know that even from birth Jesus was the King of the Jews.
Know that God advised Joseph in a dream not to be afraid to take Mary as his wife because that which was conceived in her was of the Holy Spirit.
Know that God had already foretold where Jesus would be born.
Know that Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judaea, the city of David.
Know that Jesus was born of the line of David and Abraham.
Know that Jesus was born to be Saviour.
Know that Jesus was born to save His people from their sins.
Know that Jesus was conceived in Mary by the Holy Spirit before Mary was married to Joseph and before she had any intimacy with him.
Know that Jesus was the firstborn son of the virgin Mary.
Know that Joseph did not wish to publicly put Mary to shame when he unexpectedly found her to be with child.
Know that Joseph named Mary’s firstborn child JESUS as the Lord instructed him.
Know that Joseph was not intimate with his wife Mary until after Jesus was born.
Know that Joseph’s initial intention was to privately separate and end his betrothal to Mary when he unexpectedly found her to be with child.
Know that Mary was betrothed to Joseph when Jesus was conceived in her by the Holy Spirit.
Know that Mary was the mother of Jesus.
Know that the birth of Jesus fulfilled many prophecies.
Know that the wise men were led by a star to where the baby Jesus was.

Bless the poor and be blessed.
Bless them that curse you.
Cast away your idols and be blessed.

Know that every good and perfect gift comes down from the Father above.
Know that God blesses the godly.
Know that God gives gifts to men.
Know that God gives revelation to men.
Know that God has lavished the riches of His grace upon us.

Know that godliness leads to blessing and prosperity.
Know that God’s grace flows abundantly towards His children.
Know that he who gives to the poor shall not lack.
Know that in Christ, we have been blessed with every spiritual blessing in heaven.
Know that sin robs a man of good things.
Know that the Lord blesses the habitation of the just.
Know that the Lord will bless you with plenty when you honour Him with your wealth and the first fruits of all your increase.
Know that those who have faith are blessed with Abraham.
Know that when you fear the Lord and depart from evil it will bring blessing to your health and well being.
Know that whosoever finds wisdom finds life and shall obtain favour of the Lord.

Make mercy and truth a priority in your life and you will find favour and good understanding in the sight of God and man.
Seek God with your whole heart and be blessed.
Seek God’s instruction in everything you do and He will make your paths pleasant and prosperous.
Taste and see that the Lord is good.
Thank God for all your spiritual blessings in heaven in Christ.
Know that in Christ our sins (past, present and future) have been forgiven through the ransom blood of Jesus.
Know that in Christ we have been redeemed through the blood of Jesus.
Know that the blood of Jesus cleanses our conscience from dead works.
Know that through His blood your sins are forgiven.
Know that we have been purchased by the ransom blood of Jesus.
Know that we, who were once far from God, are brought near to God by the blood of Christ.
Know that you have a clean conscience through the blood of Christ.
Know that the church (His body) is the fulfilment of Jesus who completes every good work pre-ordained for every believer within the body of Christ.
Be kindly affectioned to one another with brotherly love.
Be of the same mind as one another.
Do all that you can to remain in the unity of the Holy Spirit with fellow believers by remaining at peace with them.
Don’t be an accuser of the brethren.
Don’t minister in isolation, work with your brethren in the Lord and share your experiences openly with others.
Encourage others in their faith.
Exercise great patience and restraint with one another in godly love.
Give thanks and pray for your brothers and sisters in Christ.
Give to the necessity of the saints.

Know that as a member of the body of Christ you are nourished and cherished by Jesus.
Know that as head of the church Jesus leads by example.
Know that Christ is the saviour of the body.
Know that every part of the body (including you) is needed!
Know that everyone in the body of Christ has a unique gifting from Christ and part to play.
Know that everyone is a member of one another.
Know that everyone who confesses that Jesus Christ is come in the flesh is of God.
Know that faith in Jesus and love towards all of the saints go together hand-in-hand for believers.

Know that God is building a holy temple in which to dwell through the Holy Spirit using the saints as the individual building blocks.
Know that God is over all of us, works through all of us and is in all of us as believers.
Know that God the Father has set Jesus as head over all things to the church.
Know that God’s grace flows abundantly towards His children.
Know that God’s plan for your life will benefit others in the body of Christ.
Know that in Christ we are members of His body and to do as He (the head) commands.

Know that it is God’s wish for all men to be enlightened of His intention to unite Jews and Gentiles in fellowship within the body of Christ.
Know that it is good and pleasant for brethren to dwell together in unity.
Know that it was always God’s intention to make His manifold wisdom known to those in heavenly places through the revelation given to His church at this point in history.
Know that it was God’s hidden plan from the very beginning of the world to unite Jews and Gentiles in fellowship in the body of Christ by the gospel.
Know that Jesus is head of the church.
Know that Jesus left His Father and mother so that He could be joined to His church as one flesh.
Know that just as the head commands the body, so Jesus commands the church.
Know that neither sexual immorality, impurity, idolatry nor greed is to have any place whatsoever in the body of Christ.

Know that our faith has brought us into Christ Jesus.

Let every generation give glory to God in the church by Christ Jesus forever.
Live in harmony with one another.
Live peacably with all men as far as this is possible.

Pray continually in conversation with the Holy Spirit, vigilantly obeying and earnestly bringing your petitions to God for you and your brethren in Christ.

Pray that the body of Christ might comprehend the great extent of God’s far-reaching and profound master plan which is inclusive of unsearchable riches to both Jew and Gentile (breadth), which began before the creation and extends into eternity (length) and concerns both the heavenly (height) and earthly (depth) realms.
Pray that you and your Christian brethren may be able to fully understand the whole mystery of God’s plan.
Pray that you may know and experience the working of His great and miraculous power that is given to believers.
Pray that you may know and understand the riches of the glory of His inheritance (the Holy Spirit) in you and in the body of Christ. [1 Corinthians 12]

Remember that you are a member of the body of Christ.
Remember that you are part of the very flesh and bones of Jesus.

Take note that Paul prays for those to whom he is ministering.
Beware of false brethren who seek to bring you into bondage.
Know that you are no longer a servant of sin.
Know that you did not receive the Spirit to remain a slave to fear.

Pray that God may give you the spirit of wisdom and revelation in the experiential knowledge of His character and will.
Recognise the importance and true value of wisdom and understanding which are beyond comparison with anything you could possibly desire.
Remember that wisdom is the principal thing. [Proverbs 4:7]
Seek wisdom rather than gold.
Turn around at wisdom’s reproof and stop ignoring good advice.
Walk carefully and use your time wisely to do good because the days in which we live are evil.
Walk with wise men and you will become wise.
Wisdom is the principle thing therefore diligently seek to obtain it.
Know that the apostles were witnesses who heard, gazed steadfastly upon and touched Jesus.
As the church is subject to Christ, so let wives be to their husband in everything.
Know that the husband is head of the wife, just as Jesus is head of the church.
Know that when a man leaves his father and mother and gets married, that husband and wife become one flesh.
Wives, revere your husband.
Wives, submit to your husbands as it is right in the Lord to do.
Wives, submit to your husbands as you would to the Lord.
Delight in the Word of God.
Know God’s written Word.
Know that our trust is in Christ since we heard the Word of Truth, the good news of our salvation.
Know that Paul’s letter to the saints at Ephesus (God’s Word) is directly addressed to each of us today as faithful believers in Christ Jesus.

Know that the sacrifice of Jesus was so that He might sanctify His church, having cleansed it with the purifying power of God’s Word, so that He might present His church to Himself as a glorious church that is holy and unblemished in His sight.
Know that the Word of God is not bound.
Know that the Word of God is one of the most powerful cleansing agents in the church.
Know that the Word of Truth (Jesus) is the good news of salvation.
Live by every word of God.
Meditate on God’s word day and night.
Meditate on the Word of God day and night.
Resist the tempter with the Word of God.
Study to show your acceptance by God as a teacher correctly able to explain the Word of God.
Take note how Paul refers to the divinity and works of Jesus by quoting the scriptures. [Psalms 68:18]
Take the sword of the Spirit (the Word of God) as both a weapon and a defence.
Do not love the world or the things that are in the world.
Do not marvel when the world hates you.
Don’t be conformed to the standards of the world around you.
Escape the corruption of the world.
Know that God has appointed a day for the judgement of the world.
Know that God wants to deliver us from this present evil world.
Know that God will judge the world with righteousness.
Know that Jesus is the propitiation for our sins and and also for the sins of the whole world.
Know that Satan is currently the ruler of this world.
Know that Satan is the one behind the standards of this world.
Know that the judgement of the world will be by Jesus Christ.
Know that the world hated Jesus before it hated you.
Know that those who are not of God speak of the world and the world hears them.
Know that your belief that Jesus is the Son of God gives you the victory to overcome the world.
Know that your former life was influenced and guided by the standards of this world.
Stop loving the world.
Behold the fowls of the air and how the Father feeds them.
Consider the lilies of the field.
Don’t worry about tomorrow. Concentrate on today.
Realise that our Father in heaven knows all of our needs before we ask.
Realise that you cannot achieve anything by worrying.
Realise the value God places on you. Have faith and trust in Him.
Take no thought for what you will wear.
Take no thought for your life, what you will eat, drink or wear.
Fall down and worship Jesus.
Kiss the Son.
Know that wise men seek Jesus that they may worship Him.
Let every generation give glory to God in the church by Christ Jesus forever.
Present your body as a living sacrifice unto God.
Sing a new song to the Lord; play skillfully with a loud noise.
Worship God in spirit and in truth.
Worship the Lord thy God and serve Him only.
